computation.asedriver module¶

class computation.asedriver.AseDriver(calc=None, params: dict = {}, directory='./', *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: AbstractDriver

default_task = 'min'¶
devi_fname = 'model_devi-ase.dat'¶
property directory¶

Set working directory of this driver.

Note

The attached calculator’s directory would be set as well.

log_fname = 'dyn.log'¶
property log_fpath¶

File path of the simulation log.

name: str = 'ase'¶

Driver’s name.

read_convergence(trajectory: List[Atoms], run_params: dict, *args, **kwargs) → bool¶

Check whether the driver is finished properly.

We need run_params since it is updated when run.

TODO: Maybe read dyn.log is enough to determine convergence.

read_trajectory(add_step_info=True, *args, **kwargs)¶

Read trajectory in the current working directory.

removed_fnames: List[str] = ['dyn.log', 'dyn.traj', 'traj.xyz', 'model_devi-ase.dat']¶

List of output files would be removed when restart.

run(atoms_, read_exists: bool = True, extra_info: Optional[dict] = None, *args, **kwargs)¶

Run the driver.

Additional output files would be generated, namely a xyz-trajectory and a deviation file if the calculator could estimate uncertainty.

Note

Calculator’s parameters will not change since it still performs single-point calculations as the simulation goes.

saved_fnames: List[str] = ['traj.xyz', 'model_devi-ase.dat']¶

List of output files would be saved when restart.

supported_tasks = ['min', 'ts', 'md']¶
traj_fname = 'dyn.traj'¶
property traj_fpath¶

File path of the simulation trajectory.

xyz_fname = 'traj.xyz'¶

Keyword.

Parameters for PotentialManager.

read_converged(*args, **kwargs) → Atoms¶

Read last frame of the trajectory.

It would be better if the structure were checked to be converged.

abstract read_trajectory(*args, **kwargs) → List[Atoms]¶

Read trajectory in the current working directory.

reset() → NoReturn¶

Remove results stored in dynamics calculator.

abstract run(atoms, read_exists: bool = True, extra_info: Optional[dict] = None, *args, **kwargs) → Atoms¶

Return the last frame of the simulation.

Copy input atoms, and return a new atoms. Check whether the simulation is finished and retrieve stored results. If necessary, extra information could be added to the atoms.info

set_keywords(kwargs) → NoReturn¶

Set list of keywords from kwargs.

setting: DriverSetting = None¶

Driver setting.

Special keywords.

abstract property supported_tasks: List[str]¶

Supported simulation tasks

syswise_keys: list = []¶

Systemwise parameter keys.

class computation.lammps.LmpDriver(calc, params: dict, directory='./', *args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: AbstractDriver

Use lammps to perform dynamics.

Minimisation and/or molecular dynamics.

as_dict() → dict¶
default_task = 'min'¶
delete: list = []¶

Deleted keywords.

keyword: Optional[str] = None¶

Keyword.

name: str = 'lammps'¶

Driver’s name.

read_trajectory(type_list=None, add_step_info=True, *args, **kwargs) → List[Atoms]¶

Read trajectory in the current working directory.

run(atoms_, read_exists: bool = True, extra_info: Optional[dict] = None, **kwargs)¶

Run the driver.

If the converged results were found in the current working directory, the simulation would not be performed again. Otherwise, the results would be read.

saved_fnames: List[str] = ['log.lammps', 'traj.dump']¶

List of output files would be saved when restart.

special_keywords: dict = {}¶

Special keywords.

computation.vasp.read_sort(directory)¶

Create the sorting and resorting list from ase-sort.dat.

If the ase-sort.dat file does not exist, the sorting is redone.
